content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at approximately (2.5, 17.5)
Use-case: Assembles copper cables from raw inputs.
Consists of the following entities:
– Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
– Factory burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5); placed with direction RIGHT so that it picks up items from the input chest (at 2.5, 17.5) and drops them at (4.5, 17.5)
– Additional burner inserters:
 • Burner inserter at Position(x=1.5, y=17.5) (supplied with coal and waiting for source items)
 • Burner inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5) (awaiting source items)
– Assembling machine (assembling-machine-1) at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5) tasked with copper cable production (currently flagged for missing copper-plate and lack of power)

### Depot Belt Depot at (3.5, 15.5)
Use-case: Acts as an isolated belt depot to receive items via multi‐segment transport belts from the extraction system.
Consists of the following entities:
– Depot wooden chest at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as the belt depot
– Dedicated transport belt segment placed adjacent to the chest at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5)
– Depot burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) (placed with direction UP; its pickup position aligns with the depot chest and its drop position is set at (3.5, 13.5))

### Extraction System Module at (–3.5, 27.5)
Use-case: Extracts raw materials for feed into downstream processing.
Consists of the following entity:
– Extraction system burner inserter at Position(x=–3.5, y=27.5) with a drop position at Position(x=–3.5, y=28.5)

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
– When connecting transport belts, the target is repeatedly rejected because it is interpreted as a Prototype.SteamEngine. Always verify that the target entity is compatible (for example, use an inserter that feeds items into the engine) rather than a steam engine itself.
– Placement failed in one instance because the target position (3.5, 15.5) was too distant (15.89 units away versus a maximum of 10). Ensure that you move close enough to the target position before attempting to place an entity.
– In another case, placement of a wooden chest failed due to the item not being available in inventory. Always check that the required item is present before initiating a placement.
– A NameError occurred because “target_chest” was not defined. Confirm that all target entity variables are properly declared and assigned with the intended values before use.
